Pre-Game Insights: The Dallas Mavericks are looking to halt their longest losing streak in four seasons as they host the Los Angeles Lakers.
Dallas is 1-5 since losing Luka Doncic on Christmas Day with a left calf strain.
Kyrie Irving will be sidelined at least a week with a bulging disk in his back.
Daniel Gafford sprained his left ankle and is expected to miss some time.
The Mavericks will rely on Klay Thompson and P.J. Washington to pull them through this rough stretch.
The Lakers had won seven of nine games before their loss to the Houston Rockets.
Anthony Davis leads the Lakers with 26.0 points and 11.8 rebounds per game.
Dallas has won seven of nine against the Lakers since March 2022.
